intro: Hippomarathrum microcarpon, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its fruit is a small, round berry that contains several seeds. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
